title: Clint Mansell
text:
{{short description|English musician and composer}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Clint Mansell | image = ClintMansellAndSonusQuartet2009 fragment.jpg | caption = Mansell with the [[Sonus Quartet]], playing in Union Chapel, London, 20 July 2009 | birth_name = Clinton Darryl Mansell | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1963|1|7}} | origin = [[Coventry]], [[Warwickshire]], England | genre = [[Film score]], [[alternative rock]], [[grebo rock]], [[Electronic music|electronic]], [[industrial rock]], [[Classical music|classical]] | occupation = Musician, singer, composer | instrument = [[Vocals]], [[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]], [[guitar]], [[Bass guitar|bass]] | years_active = 1981–present | label = | associated_acts = [[Pop Will Eat Itself]] | website = [https://iamclintmansell.com/ iamclintmansell.com] }} '''Clinton Darryl Mansell''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|m|æ|n|s|əl}}; born 7 January 1963) is an English [[musician]], [[Singing|singer]], and [[composer]], born in [[Coventry]]. He served as the lead singer and [[multi-instrumentalist]] of alt-rock band [[Pop Will Eat Itself]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0543739/|title=Clint Mansell|publisher=IMDb|access-date=11 March 2019}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0543739/otherworks|title=Clint Mansell|publisher=IMDb|access-date=11 March 2019}} before embarking on a career as a [[film score]] composer. Mansell moved to the United States after the dissolution of the group and started working with filmmaker [[Darren Aronofsky]]. He has subsequently become an award-winning, [[Golden Globe]] and [[Grammy Award|Grammy]]-nominated film composer,{{Cite web|url=https://www.royalalberthall.com/about-the-hall/news/2016/february/clint-mansells/|title=Five essential film scores by award-winning composer Clint Mansell {{!}} Royal Albert Hall|website=Royal Albert Hall|language=en-GB|access-date=11 March 2019}} collaborating extensively with Aronofsky and writing scores for dozens of other films (both shorts and features), TV series, and video games. Mansell resides in [[Los Angeles]], composing and occasionally touring live versions of his work.{{Cite web|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/dreadlocks-no-locks-amazing-transformation-11083614|title=From dreadlocks to no locks - the amazing transformation of pop star turned Hollywood composer Clint Mansell|last=Young|first=Graham|date=23 March 2016|website=Birmingham Mail|access-date=11 March 2019}} A pioneer of sampling in his own work, Mansell's work is now a favourite with sampling musicians.{{Cite web|url=https://www.musicbusinessworldwide.com/decca-publishing-signs-composer-and-musician-clint-mansell/|title=Decca Publishing signs composer and musician Clint Mansell|date=14 February 2019|website=Music Business Worldwide|language=en-US|access-date=11 March 2019}} ==Career== ===Pop career=== Mansell was raised in [[Coventry]], then in [[Warwickshire]]. For a decade from their foundation in 1986, Mansell was a member of [[Pop Will Eat Itself]], as a lead vocalist, multi-instrumentalist, producer and writer or co-writer of many of the band's songs.{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/pop-will-eat-itself-mn0000852810/biography|title=Pop Will Eat Itself {{!}} Biography & History|publisher=AllMusic|language=en-us|access-date=11 March 2019}} The band were pioneers of [[Sampling (music)|sampling]] and [[Electronic musical instrument|electronic music]] in the UK [[Alternative rock|alternative rock scene]], bringing influences from [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], [[industrial music]], [[House music|house]], and other [[Dance music|dance]] genres into their music. In the United States, PWEI were signed in 1994 to [[Nothing Records]] the label owned by [[Trent Reznor]] of [[Nine Inch Nails]]. Mansell and Reznor, a long time fan of PWEI, became friends after Mansell moved to New York, and Mansell subsequently performed backing vocals on Nine Inch Nails' 1999 album ''[[The Fragile (Nine Inch Nails album)|The Fragile]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://sabotagetimes.com/life/clint-mansell-aronofsky-reznor-and-me-part-one|title=Clint Mansell: Aronofsky, Reznor and Me, Part One|last=Godfrey|first=Alex|website=Sabotage Times|language=en|access-date=11 March 2019|archive-date=23 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623141358/https://sabotagetimes.com/life/clint-mansell-aronofsky-reznor-and-me-part-one|url-status=dead}} ===Soundtrack composer=== Mansell started composing film soundtracks when director [[Darren Aronofsky]] hired him to score his debut film, ''[[Pi (film)|Pi]]'', in 1996.Pete Paphides [http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article6716423.ece Clint Mansell: pop ate itself, and out popped Hollywood] ''[[The Times]]'' Retrieved 14 May 2010 He also wrote the [[Requiem for a Dream (soundtrack)|score]] for Aronofsky's next film, ''[[Requiem for a Dream]]'', which became a [[cult following|cult]] hit.[http://www.allmusic.com/album/r499057 Requiem for a Dream – Clint Mansell] [[AllMusic]] Retrieved 31 January 2011 The film's primary composition "[[Lux Aeterna (Mansell)|Lux Aeterna]]" was popular, appearing in adverts, [[film trailer]]s,[http://www.bmi.com/special/sundance2009_composers Sundance 2009 Composers – Clint Mansell] ''[[Broadcast Music Incorporated|BMI]]'' Retrieved 31 January 2011 and [[YouTube]] videos labelled as Epic Music. Mansell has composed the music to every subsequent Aronofsky film with the sole exception of ''[[mother!]]''.Bray, Elisa (28 January 2011) [https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/duo-darren-aronofsky-and-clint-mansell-score-on-pointes-2196210.html Duo Darren Aronofsky and Clint Mansell score on pointes] ''[[The Independent]]'' Retrieved 31 January 2011 ===Film trailers=== The trailer for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'' used an orchestral and choral arrangement of "Lux Aeterna", called "[[Requiem for a Tower]]". This orchestration was arranged by Simone Benyacar, Dan Nielsen and [[Veigar Margeirsson]].{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/requiem-for-tower-dream-single/id317781690|title=Requiem for a Tower Dream by Various Artists on Apple Music|access-date=30 November 2016}} The original "Lux Aeterna" and "Requiem for a Tower" arrangements have been used in ''[[Zathura: A Space Adventure]]'', ''[[The Da Vinci Code (film)|The Da Vinci Code]]'',[http://www.traileraddict.com/trailer/da-vinci-code/trailer The Da Vinci Code Trailer] Retrieved 31 January 2011 ''[[Sunshine (2007 film)|Sunshine]]'', ''[[Babylon A.D.]]'', ''[[Lost (2004 TV series)|Lost]]'', ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'', ''[[Soccer Saturday]]'', EuroSport LIVE and ''[[America's Got Talent]]''. Mansell's theme from the film ''[[Moon (2009 film)|Moon]]'' appears on the trailer for ''[[The Iron Lady (film)|The Iron Lady]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.theironladymovie.co.uk/blog/|title=Streama Film - Allt Om Laglig Streaming TV & Film Online|access-date=30 November 2016}} and the computer game ''[[Aliens: Colonial Marines]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EfOOOAN9e9w |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211212/EfOOOAN9e9w| archive-date=2021-12-12 |url-status=live|title=Exclusive Aliens: Colonial Marines Cinematic Trailer|last=IGN|date=27 January 2012|access-date=30 November 2016|via=YouTube}}{{cbignore}} === Publishing deal === In February 2019, Mansell signed a publishing deal with Decca Publishing, a division in [[Decca Music Group|Decca Music]]. This deal brought his catalogue of more than 650 original pieces, including his Pop Will Eat Itself work, under a single umbrella for the first time. === Other work === Other work includes creating the music for Coventry [[UK City of Culture|UK City of Culture's]] manifesto film{{Cite web|title=Uncommon’s modular Coventry City of Culture identity references the city’s brutalist history|url=https://www.itsnicethat.com/news/uncommon-coventry-city-of-culture-identity-graphic-design-280720|access-date=18 August 2020|website=itsnicethat.com|language=en}} which was released in July 2020.{{Cite web|last=LLoyd|first=Matt|date=27 July 2020|title=Inspirational film launches new City of Culture brand|url=https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/inspirational-film-charting-coventrys-history-18664093|access-date=18 August 2020|website=CoventryLive}} ==Discography== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" |- !rowspan="2" style="width:15px;"| Year !rowspan="2" style="width:225px;"| Album details !colspan="3"| Peak chart positions |- !style="width:4em;font-size:75%"|[[UK Album Chart|UK]]
